title: How to to start my career in singing - Quora

response.answer_text: First thing is this: Think of it as a business. Do not think about anything else. Your talent, your skills, your dreams, your goals, your fans, admirers, fans, blah blah blah. All that stuff comes easy, pretty much on it’s own, because that’s the stuff everyone sees and, they wrongly believe that’s all there is to it. Nope. Wrong. It’s the surface. The thing that makes it happen, the “guts” that you don’t see under the surface is the business. I’m not talking about “business” in terms of the gazillions of $. That’s not the point. The point is if you don’t have a grasp of how business works - ANY business - then you will taken for a ride. Would you get inside a stranger’s car? Of course not. If you were “drunk” with popularity, accolades and sweet talk and drinks and party, then you would be more easily saying yes to the car ride. It’s the same with the “success” you make in your new vocalist career. Don’t wait for the surface stuff to happen before you “get serious” about the business side of it. You don’t want to get into that “stranger’s car” of a career and think it’s all safe just because you’ve been assured by all the surface stuff. Here’s some resources. I don’t know about the actual product that Leah Harnett delivers but I’ve been reading a lot of her offers by the emails I signed up to get and they all indicate she will deliver a very level-headed business side of things, including promo. The message is “It’s like an investment. Money in money out and here’s how to make it happen and monitor it.” Here’s the latest link I got: https://t.dripemail2. For vocal technique, I like Ken Tamplin. Great guy. Down to earth. Has the chops. Ken Tamplin Vocal Academy - Learn How To Sing Better Online Also, he made some business related errors of judgment and got jettisoned from the industry. If that didn’t happen then he would have been in the same level as REO Speedwagon, Foreigner, Boston etc. If you look at his website you’ll likely find a bit of the bio on that. Not gonna wish you luck because success ( “luck, chance, fate” ) only comes to those who are prepared.

Thats a tough one considering I don’t know where you are starting. Lets assume you sing in the choir or karaoke or something. Beware if you are going on the recommendation of people at karaoke that you are really good. You had sure better be because the competition s fierce out there. Lets assume that you are really good. You are still in competition with college voice majors and drama majors. You can take a trip to Nashville and find people standing on the street corners singing their arses off. These statements are not made to discourage you but to let you know what you are going to encounter. You better have some thick skin when you are starting out and even after you score some gigs. Funny thing about the public. If you are performing for them they feel they have to right to walk right up and tell you why they don’t like you. If you are a little heavy they think it is their god given right to point it out/ I have been performing for so long I don’t pay attention to any of it which means I don’t listen to the compliments either. That being said you need to make some demo tapes. Video and audio and some good head shots. It gonna cost some bucks but the better the quality the better the chance you will have of getting some gigs. Remember the old saying dress for the job you want to get. You need to have promo that says I am professional before you are professional. Be objective. Get some opinions of people other than your friends and relatives. After you get the promo up to speed take them around to some talent agents that handle voice overs or if you are shooting for live performances agents that handle that sort of gig. You must have an objective and apply your promo in the right places. There are also online booking agents ( Gigmasters and Gigsalad ) that will book you for a price. Everyone want to to specalize in something in order to market you. Wedding Singer, Jingle singer, impersonator singer, nightclub singer, gospel singer, country singer, pop singer, heavy metal singer. In order to compete you must narrow down your marketing options. If you are bitten by the performance bug there is nothing you can do but go with the flow. Get your promo together and start knocking on doors.

Singing is a very rich field that will shower anyone who wants to pursue it with a lot of opportunities. But, it is important that the starting phase of your career is something that you can put up on your portfolio. For this, you will need things like a great agent who can hook you up with clients that have a great name in the music industry. Not only this will cost a great amount of money but also with all the modernization and use of internet, music producers always look for talent on online listings. Thus, for someone who is already in an online listing will have a better chance of getting the job rather than someone who has just created a posting last day.  But, with their being so many platforms and portals for musicians these days, it has become hard as to choose the right one to look out for job. This is something where DOODEO comes in. It is one of the best market place for singers and musicians as the listings on their website are classified and also verified for proper clientele. Thus, for a client, this is nothing but the best place to look for new talent and so, being in the listings will improve your chances of having a job. Some of the things that you should remember in the starting phase of your career are: Being Up-to-date: Make sure that your profile is up to date. This will get you a better chance in a hiring as they will see that you are active and serious for your passionCheck regularly: It is important to check the listings regularly for jobsStart with low Pay scale: In you beginner days, do not head for fortune, start with taking jobs and focus on building your name in the industry.Thanks!

You didn't say if you can sing? Do you have any connections in the business? Do you live in LA or NYC or Chicago or San Fernando valley or Las Vegas. Helps to be where the connections are. What cha got? Gotta have “it” to be in the entertainment world. If you don't have it, you'll find it tough. America's Got Talent is good. Do you go on auditions? You have to rock the people you sing for worlds with your voice and your performance. You gave me nothing to work with. Can you really play an instrument? I am not talking about picking a few cords here and there. I mean play it so that people want more. Do people cry from emotion when you sing? Do people get up and dance even when there is no dance floor? When you sing, do people ask for requests? When you're done singing and playing or just singing are people waiting at the door to tell you how good you sing? Have you had some lessons? Are people climbing all over themselves to sing with you because you sound so good and they think if they sing with you they'll sound good too? Do you have one or two outfits that make you pop? Do you have a following? People who show up because you're going to sing there. Give me something to work with. What do you have to offer?

You are talking about 3 aspects: singingcareerhow to start→ 1. You have to find your voice first. That will be the driver that will get your career started and will drive you for the long term on the success line. By finding your voice you will know who you are to the deepest levels of your identity, you will know what you want, what you need, your values and boundaries, your goals, and your WHY. That will keep you safe and strong in any storm or temptation in the industry. → 2. Then you need to know your voice type, singer type, your micro-niche, and your platforms + efficient marketing hacks to be able to market to the right people and have a recurring stream of income as well as a raving fanbase. → 3. The third step is you learn how to manage yourself, your health, your time, your music business, and your voice with tools, routines, and schedules. Last step: you find a vocal coach/mentor that will support and guide you fully on ALL OF THE ABOVE. Happy Career Building ;) *eR ;) E L L A R A Y Soundstonez
